name: PHP Package Authoring Quickstart Guide
tagline: Quickstart guide for creating PHP packages.
body:
## Impatient / Repetitive

1. Add the following webhooks:

    1. _Packagist_

1. _Add/Enable_ new repository on:

    1. [Travis-CI](https://travis-ci.org/profile)
    1. [Coverall.io account]
    1. [Packagist.org](https://packagist.org/packages/submit)

1. Commit and push the following `.travis.yml` file:

    ```yml
    language: php

    php:
      - 5.4
      - 5.5
      - hhvm

    before_script:
      - composer self-update
      - composer --prefer-source install
      - composer require -n satooshi/php-coveralls:dev-master

    script:
      - phpunit --coverage-text --coverage-clover build/logs/clover.xml

    matrix:
      allow_failures:
        - php: hhvm

    after_success:
      - php vendor/bin/coveralls -v
    ```

1. Add badges to your `README.md`:

    ```yml
    [![Build Status](https://travis-ci.org/owner/repo.svg)](https://travis-ci.org/owner/repo)
    [![Coverage Status](https://img.shields.io/coveralls/owner/repo.svg)](https://coveralls.io/r/owner/repo)
    [![Latest Version](http://img.shields.io/packagist/v/owner/repo.svg)](https://packagist.org/packages/owner/repo)
    ```
    Find more on http://shields.io/ & https://github.com/pixel-cookers/built-with-badges…


---

## Step by step, explained

### Create

1. Quick naming

1. composer init

1. PSR-4

1. .gitignore

    ```
    vendor/
    ```

1. phpunit.xml.dist

    ```xml
    <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
    <phpunit
      bootstrap="./vendor/autoload.php"
      beStrictAboutTestsThatDoNotTestAnything="true"
      beStrictAboutOutputDuringTests="true"
      beStrictAboutTestSize="true"
      checkForUnintentionallyCoveredCode="false"
      forceCoversAnnotation="true"
      colors="true"
    >
      <testsuites>
        <testsuite name="MyPackageName Test Suite">
          <directory>./tests/src</directory>
        </testsuite>
      </testsuites>

      <!-- Filter for coverage reports. -->
      <filter>
        <blacklist>
          <directory>./tests/fixtures</directory>
          <directory>./vendor</directory>
        </blacklist>
      </filter>
    </phpunit>
    ```

1. Prototype code

1. Immediately start to cover your expectations in tests.

1. Naming (see _Publish_ below)


### Quality Assurance

1. Do _write_, and do _run_, unit tests.

    ```sh
    phpunit
    ```

1. Ensure your code isn't total CRAP.

    ```sh
    phpunit --coverage-html cov
    ```
    …generates a _fully-fledged_ and _beautiful_ code coverage report in `./cov/`
    — just open it in your browser (no web server required).

    → Make sure your code doesn't stink.


### Publish

1. **Naming is hard.**



#### Travis-CI (and PHPUnit)

1. Log in (or register) at https://travis-ci.org

1. _Enable_ it for your new repo

1. Commit and push a `/.travis.yml` file:

    ```yml
    language: php

    php:
      - 5.4
      - 5.5
      # Optional; Please verify whether your code is able to run on the HHVM
      # architecture first; otherwise, you're just wasting Travis-CI resources.
      - hhvm

    before_script:
      # Composer is installed globally, but usually older than a month.
      - composer self-update
      - composer --prefer-source install

    script:
      # A reasonably up-to-date PHPUnit stable is installed globally, so you
      # can just use it.
      - phpunit --coverage-text

    matrix:
      allow_failures:
        - php: hhvm
    ```


#### Coveralls.io

1. Log in at https://coveralls.io

1. _Add repository_

1. Add the following to your `.travis.yml` file:

    ```yml
    before_script:
      # Test code coverage reporting is a pure build/QA/CI integration tool;
      # do NOT add it to your composer.json.
      - composer require -n satooshi/php-coveralls:dev-master

    script:
      # Generate a clover report in the location expected by coveralls.
      - phpunit --coverage-text --coverage-clover build/logs/clover.xml

    after_success:
      # Submit build to coveralls.io.
      - php vendor/bin/coveralls -v
    ```
    Alternatively use `after_script`. (no best practice yet)


#### Scrutinizer

1. Log in at https://scrutinizer-ci.com/

1. _Add repository_

1. Configure... @todo

    Too many/tons of options...

    


#### Packagist

1. Log in (or register) at https://packagist.org

1. Connect your GitHub account (in your [Packagist.org profile])

1. Hit _[Submit package](https://packagist.org/packages/submit)_  

    _First-time intro: [https://packagist.org/about](https://packagist.org/about)_

1. Copy GitHub repo URL

1. Add _Packagist_ as a webhook in your GitHub repository _Settings_.  

    _Note: Enter your **token**, not your password. Don't trust your password manager._


#### Badges

1. Add badges to your `README.md`:

    ```yml
    [![Build Status](https://travis-ci.org/owner/repo.svg)](https://travis-ci.org/owner/repo)
    [![Coverage Status](https://img.shields.io/coveralls/owner/repo.svg)](https://coveralls.io/r/owner/repo)
    [![Latest Version](http://img.shields.io/packagist/v/owner/repo.svg)](https://packagist.org/packages/owner/repo)
    ```
    Find more on http://shields.io/ & https://github.com/pixel-cookers/built-with-badges…


### Documentation

#### README.md

1. License + Copyright

    Also: LICENSE[.md].

    Careful: Borrowed code [lines] (derivative work).



#### In code

1. License + Copyright

    Your code is _distributed_ as a package. Only your package declares a
    license. Do NOT add a full license header to _all_ of your files.

    That's duplicate code.  Not maintainable and distracting. Unnecessary by
    universal copyright laws.  
    _Disclaimer: This is not legal advice.  Consult your lawyer._

    See [README.md](#README-md) chapter above.

    At maximum, use this in the file-level PHPDoc:

    ```php
    /**
     * @copyright 2013-2014 Daniel F. Kudwien <sun@unleashedmind.com>
     * @license   GPL-2.0+ GNU General Public License v2.0 or later
     */
    ```
    Use a [SPDX Open Source License Registry](http://spdx.org/licenses/)
    identifier for `@license` instead of a URL.  
    _(PSR-5-compliant)_



[Coverall.io account]: https://coveralls.io/repos
[Packagist.org account]: https://packagist.org/profile/
